title: D - Custom PS Header - Postseason
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed on iPad or iPhone
custom_steps:
When a user taps on the Postseason view
and swipes the WC, DS, LCS views
custom_expected:
Then user will see a blue background on the header (rgb 10 30 64)
and see a custom Postseason image centered

Should be one image with MLB.com logo, Postseason text, current year, broadcaster logos for entire Postseason

title: Custom PS Header - Postseason - Configurable Image
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed on iPad or iPhone
custom_steps: When seriesHeaderImageFilename is set for a specific round in the config
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the specific image in the header for that round

Test for each round

title: Custom PS Header - Postseason - Configurable Text
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed on iPad or iPhone
custom_steps: When seriesHeaderText is set for a specific round in the config
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the specific text in the header for that round

Test for each round

and swipes to DS
and taps on View Full Series

and blue background on the header (rgb 10 30 64)
and see a custom Division Series image centered

Should be one image with MLB.com logo, Division Series text, current year, broadcaster logos for entire Division Series

title: If Necessary game row

custom_steps: When a user taps on Postseason

custom_steps_separated.content:
and views the Divisional Series (DS)
and taps to view the Full Series

Expand All Series on iPad
View Full Series on iPhone
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see Game 4 and Game 5 rows
and the rows will be grey and not bold like the necessary games
and there will be star next to the number

custom_steps_separated.content:
and views the Divisional Series (DS)
and taps view the Full Series

Expand All Series on iPad
View Full Series on iPhone
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see Game 5, Game 6, and Game 7 rows
and the rows will be grey and not bold like the necessary games
and there will be star next to the number

custom_steps_separated.content:
and views the World Series (WS)
and views the Full Series
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then the user will see Game 5, Game 6, and Game 7 rows
and the rows will be grey and not bold like the necessary games
and there will be star next to the number

title: If Necessary - Best of 5
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on Postseason
and views the full series between Team A and Team B

custom_steps_separated.content:
and only game 1 is in final
and Team A won

Series 1-0
custom_steps_separated.expected: then Game 4 and Game 5 are still if necessary

custom_steps_separated.content:
and only game 2 is in final
and Team A won

Series 2-0
custom_steps_separated.expected: then Game 4 and Game 5 are still if necessary

custom_steps_separated.content:
and only game 3 is in final
and Team B won

Series 2-1
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then Game 4 is necessary 
and the row is now matches the previous played games
and If Necessary indicator is removed
and Game 5 is still if necessary

custom_steps_separated.content:
and only game 4 is in final
and Team B won

Series 2-2
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Game 5 is necessary 
and the row is now matches the previous played games
and If Necessary indicator is removed

title: If Necessary - Best of 5 - Sweep
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on Postseason
and views the full series between Team A and Team B
and Team A won Game 1, Game 2, and Game 3
custom_expected: Then the user will not see Game 4 or Game 5

title: If Necessary - Best of 7
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on Postseason
and views the full series between Team A and Team B

custom_steps_separated.content:
and only game 1 is in final
and Team A won

Series 1-0
custom_steps_separated.expected: then Game 5, Game 6, and Game 7 are still if necessary

custom_steps_separated.content:
and only game 2 is in final
and Team B won

Series 1-1
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then Game 5 is necessary 
and the row is now matches the previous played games
and If Necessary indicator is removed
and Game 6, and Game 7 are still if necessary

custom_steps_separated.content:
and only game 3 is in final
and Team A won

Series 2-1
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then Game 5 is necessary 
and the row is now matches the previous played games
and If Necessary indicator is removed
and Game 6, and Game 7 are still if necessary

custom_steps_separated.content:
and only game 4 is in final
and Team A won

Series 3-1
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then Game 5 is necessary 
and the row is now matches the previous played games
and If Necessary indicator is removed
and Game 6, and Game 7 are still if necessary

custom_steps_separated.content:
and only game 5 is in final
and Team B won

Series 3-2
custom_steps_separated.expected:
then Game 6 is necessary 
and the row is now matches the previous played games
and If Necessary indicator is removed
and Game 7 are still if necessary

custom_steps_separated.content:
and only game 6 is in final
and Team B won

Series 3-3
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Game 7 is necessary 
and the row is now matches the previous played games
and If Necessary indicator is removed

title: If Necessary - Best of 7 - Sweep
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user taps on Postseason
and views the full series between Team A and Team B
and Team A won Game 1, Game 2, Game 3, and Game 4
custom_expected: Then the user will not see Game 5, Game 6, and Game 7

and the Schedule button will be the fourth

then the user will see 4 games in schedule module
and the Schedule button will be the fifth

title: Pitching - Number/Handedness
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iPhone
and there is a live Postseason game
custom_steps:
When the user launches Gameday for the live Postseason game
and is viewing the Gameday Live tab
and the game is in the Top or Bot of an inning
custom_expected: Then the current pitcher's jersey number and handedness will be displayed on the same line as "Pitching:"

title: Pitching - Live Stats
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iPhone
and there is a live Postseason game
custom_steps:
When the user launches Gameday for the live Postseason game
and is viewing the Gameday Live tab
and the game is in the Top or Bot of an inning
custom_expected: Then the current pitcher's live game stats (IP, K, P-S) will appear on the same line as his last name

title: Pitching - Postseason ERA
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iPhone
and there is a live Postseason game
custom_steps:
When the user launches Gameday for the live Postseason game
and is viewing the Gameday Live tab
and the game is in the Top or Bot of an inning
custom_expected: Then the current pitcher's cumulative Postseason ERA for that year will be displayed underneath his last name

title: Pitching - Regular Season Stats
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iPhone
and there is a live Postseason game
custom_steps:
When the user launches Gameday for the live Postseason game
and is viewing the Gameday Live tab
and the game is in the Top or Bot of an inning
custom_expected:
Then the current pitcher's regular season ERA will be displayed on the same line as his Postseason ERA
but will include a (Regular Season) text to the right of it

title: Pitching - No Regular Season Stats
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iPhone
and there is a live Postseason game
custom_steps:
When the user launches Gameday for the live Postseason game
and is viewing the Gameday Live tab
and the game is in the Top or Bot of an inning
and the current pitcher hasn't pitched in the regular season and has no regular season ERA
custom_expected: Then the following should be displayed: -.-- ERA (Regular Season)

custom_preconds:

Given MLB app is installed on an iPhone

custom_steps:
When the user launches Gameday for the live Postseason game
and is viewing the Gameday Live tab
and the game is in the Top or Bot of an inning

custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iPhone
and there is a live Postseason game
custom_steps:

custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed on an iPhone
and there is a live Postseason game
custom_steps:

and is viewing the Gameday Live tab
and the game is in the Top or Bot of an inning

title: Suggested Date

custom_steps_separated.expected: then the Widget will display games on that day

and the user opens At Bat
custom_expected: Then the user will see the Postseason view

and the user opens At Bat

Then the user will see the Postseason view
and tapping into the Postseason will display that year

title: Postseason Team
custom_preconds:
Given a user has At Bat installed on iOS device with Extension
and has a Favorite Team set
custom_steps:
When a Dev sets the isPostSeason: 1 in the extensionConfig section of the config
and a Dev adds the team_id is added to the array in the postseasonTeams: []
and a Dev adds the year is set in postseasonSeason
and when a user navigates to the Widget on a day with a game for that team
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the game details

Respect the 10am flip rule

and the team_id is not added to the array in the postseasonTeams: []
and a Dev adds the year is set in postseasonSeason
and when a user navigates to the Widget
custom_expected: Then the user will see the team news in the Widget

and Postseason game from day after next with Postseason content

title: Stats Season
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a Dev sets the statsSeason to 2017
and a user opens At Bat
and taps on the main Stats view (not the Team Page)
custom_expected: Then the user will see the that year as the default Stats

title: Stat Type
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a Dev sets the defaultStatsGameType to a number
and a user opens At Bat 
and taps on the main Stats view (not from the Team Page)
custom_expected:
Then the user will see that stats type as the defaullt

Based off of these defaultStatsType values:
* 1  Exhibition
* 2  Spring Training
* 4  Regular Season
* 8  Postseason (Combined) - This shows as just "Postseason".
* 16  World Series
* 32  League Championship Series
* 64  Division Series
* 128  Wild Card
* 256  Game Type Max

title: Team Page Stats
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When When Ops sets statsMode is set to a value for a team(s)
and a user opens At Bat
and taps on that Team Page
and taps on Stats
custom_expected:
Then that stat type is displayed in the Stats view for that team

0 = Spring
1 = Regular Season
2 = Postseason Total
3 = Wild Card
4 = Division
5 = LCS
6 = WS

title: National Feed - Live
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is logged in
and taps on a National Feed 

From Team Page, Scoreboard, Gameday, Postseason

custom_steps_separated.content: as a Lite user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the MLB.TV Paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: as a At Bat user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the MLB.TV paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: as a Single Team User (own team's feed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the Cable Auth Flow

custom_steps_separated.content: as a Single Team User (another team's feed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see an Access Issue message

custom_steps_separated.content: as a TV-entitled User
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the Cable Auth Flow

custom_steps_separated.content: Executive Account
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will bypass the Cable Auth Flow and view the feed

title: International Feed - Live
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is logged in
and taps on an International Feed

From Team Page, Scoreboard, Gameday, Postseason

custom_steps_separated.content: As a Lite User
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see MLB.TV Paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: as a At Bat user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the MLB.TV paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: as a Single Team User and in the US
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see see the international blackout message

custom_steps_separated.content: as a TV-entitled User and in the US
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see see the international blackout message

custom_steps_separated.content: as a TV-entitled User and outside the US
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will view the feed

custom_steps_separated.content: Executive Account
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will bypass the Cable Auth Flow and view the feed

title: Archive
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps: When a user taps on a Postseason archive feed

custom_steps_separated.content: as a Lite user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the MLB.TV Paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: as a At Bat user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the MLB.TV Paywall

custom_steps_separated.content: as a Single Team User (own team's feed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the archive feed will start

custom_steps_separated.content: as a Single Team User (another team's feed)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will receive an Access Issue message

custom_steps_separated.content: as a TV-entitled User
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the archive feed will start

custom_steps_separated.content: Executive Account
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the archive feed will start

title: Cable Auth - Positive
custom_preconds:
Given a user has At Bat installed
and logged in with TV-entitled account
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a MLB.TV Postseason feed
then the user will see the cable auth flow

custom_steps_separated.content:
and has cable creds for FS1
and accessing FS1 feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the feed will start

custom_steps_separated.content:
and has cable creds for Fox
and accessing Fox feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the feed will start

custom_steps_separated.content:
and has cable creds for MLB Network
and accessing MLB Network feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the feed will start

custom_steps_separated.content:
and has cable creds for TBS
and accessing TBS feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the feed will start

title: Cable Auth - Negative
custom_preconds:
Given a user has At Bat installed
and logged in with TV-entitled account
custom_steps:
When a user taps on a MLB.TV Postseason feed
then the user will see the cable auth flow

custom_steps_separated.content:
and does not have cable creds for FS1
and accessing FS1 feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see a message on the cable auth flow screen that they can't access the feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
and does not have cable creds for Fox
and accessing Fox feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see a message on the cable auth flow screen that they can't access the feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
and does not have cable creds for MLB Network
and accessing MLB Network feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see a message on the cable auth flow screen that they can't access the feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
and does not have cable creds for TBS
and accessing TBS feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: then the user will see a message on the cable auth flow screen that they can't access the feed

title: Blackout Message
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When a user is logged in with MLB.TV account
and taps on a MLB.TV Postseason feed

custom_steps_separated.content: inside the US and taps on international feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the Blackout Message

custom_steps_separated.content: outside the US and taps on the national feed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the Blackout Message

title: Logged In TV-Entitled User
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and the user has logged in to At Bat with an MLB account that is TV-entitled
and there are live Postseason TV feeds available

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navs to the MLB.TV EPG via the TV icon in the top left corner
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be presented with the day's TV feeds

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps a live US Feed for any of the participating networks
(TBS, FS1, FOX, MLBN)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be prompted that "At Bat wants to use 'mlb.com' to sign in"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps "Continue" from the prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to a webview where they can select their cable provider from a drop-down

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects their cable provider from the drop down
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the provider login page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user enters valid cable provider credentials that include the network package
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is deeplinked back to the app and the feed will launch

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs back to the TV EPG
and selects a live Postseason feed from the same network they auth'd for
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to successfully launch the feed

title: In-App Purchase TV-Entitled User
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and the user has purchased TV via in-app purchase
and is not logged in to the app
and has NOT linked to an MLB account

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navs to the MLB.TV EPG via the TV icon in the top left corner
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be presented with the day's TV feeds

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps a live US Feed for any of the participating networks
(TBS, FS1, FOX, MLBN)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be prompted that "At Bat wants to use 'mlb.com' to sign in"

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps "Continue" from the prompt
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be taken to a webview where they can select their cable provider from a drop-down

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects their cable provider from the drop down
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the provider login page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user enters valid cable provider credentials that include the network package
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is deeplinked back to the app and the feed will launch

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs back to the TV EPG
and selects a live Postseason feed from the same network they auth'd for
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to successfully launch the feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navs to Settings
and logs in to the app with a non-entitled MLB account
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user's in-app purchase and the cable auth entitlements will now be linked to the MLB account

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user tries to launch a live Postseason US feed from the same network they auth'd for
after having linked to an MLB account
and remains logged in to the MLB account
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to successfully launch the feed

title: Non-Participating Networks
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and the user is TV-entitled

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user tries to access a non-participating Postseason game (i.e. games tied to broadcasters that don't support MVPD access for U.S. users during the Postseason) (ESPN)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be nationally blacked out of the feed
and will receive a blackout message

title: All Premium Users
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there are live Postseason Gameday Audio feeds available

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is an At Bat Premium user
and attempts to access stream game audio live via the Audio EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is able to stream game audio live

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is a TV-entitled user
and attempts to access stream game audio live via the Audio EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is able to stream game audio live

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user is a Single Team user
and attempts to access stream game audio live via the Audio EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is able to stream game audio live

title: iPhone and iPad
custom_preconds: Given a user has At Bat installed
custom_steps:
When Ops sets a hideSchedule to 1 for a team that is eliminated or not in the Postseason
and a user opens At Bat
and taps on that Team Page
custom_expected:
Then the user will not see the Schedule Module
and see the News section below the header
